page.title: 16THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
page.content: The Rushbury & Cardington{W.I.}has 55 members ranging between 25 & 80 years. We pay an annual subscription of Â£4. Meetings are held once a month and 10 committee members are elected at the Annual meeting in November.{Membership {}is drawn from a very wide area.There is a good Drama section,a Rambling group,Craft work with lessons during the winter for embroidery,lampshades & dressing,and a Catering Group who provide teas for the local Golden Age Club,Helping Hand for the Disabled and the District Nursing Ass..An evening {visit}to the local Craft College at Westhope took place in September.The programme for the year 1985 included a talk on Nature Conservation;Fire Prevention in the Home;Diamonds; practical{demonstrations}were held of making Gateaux and of Corn Dollies.
